perturbation.original_text: 4. Exclusivity. Wade agrees that during the Term of this Agreement, he will not represent or perform as a representative, spokesperson or provide Wade Services for, nor furnish services  or materials, or allow the use of the Wade Image to be used for the advertising,  endorsement, promotion, or sale of Innerwear in the Territory. Furthermore, Wade will not engage in any business or other transaction or have any financial or personal interest in any entity whose primary or core business is selling or  manufacturing Innerwear during the Term. Endorsement of any Innerwear other than the Naked Products or Wade Products without the express written consent of Naked will constitute a material breach of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. Exclusivity. Wade agrees that during the Term of this Agreement, he will use reasonable efforts to avoid representing or performing as a representative, spokesperson or providing Wade Services for, nor furnishing services  or materials, or allowing the use of the Wade Image to be used for the advertising,  endorsement, promotion, or sale of Innerwear in the Territory. Furthermore, Wade will not engage in any business or other transaction or have any direct financial interest in any entity whose primary or core business is selling or  manufacturing Innerwear during the Term. Endorsement of any Innerwear other than the Naked Products or Wade Products without the express written consent of Naked will only constitute a material breach of this Agreement if such endorsement is deemed detrimental to Naked's brand, at Naked's sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text contains a strict exclusivity clause, prohibiting Wade from endorsing or being involved with any competing Innerwear brands. The modified text weakens this clause by using 'reasonable efforts to avoid' instead of a hard prohibition, and by adding that endorsement of competing products only constitutes a breach if deemed detrimental to Naked's brand, which introduces subjectivity and makes the clause harder to enforce.

perturbation.changed_text:
14. Intellectual Property. All rights to the use of the names, trademarks, service marks, symbols, logos, domain names, trade secrets, confidential know-how, patents, copyrights, any pending applications with respect to any of the foregoing, and  any other intellectual property and related proprietary rights, interests and protections ("Intellectual Property Rights") in connection with Wade Products will be jointly owned by Wade and Naked, unless otherwise agreed in writing. Wade will retain all ownership of the Intellectual Property Rights in connection with Wade Image including, for the avoidance of doubt, the Logo, except for uses directly related to the Naked Products. For the avoidance of doubt, no rights are being granted hereunder to any intellectual property belonging to the NBA or its member clubs (including but not limited to the Miami Heat).

Subject to Section 14A, Naked will retain all ownership of the Intellectual Property Rights in connection with the Naked Products, the Naked brand and any and all related brands. All advertising material produced  hereunder will be the property of both Wade and Naked, with both parties retaining the right to use the material, unless either party expressly forbids so. Wade acknowledges that he does not now have and in the future will assert no right, title or interest of any kind or nature whatsoever therein, or in or to any component part or tape, dub or copy or element or character or characterization thereof, only when it contradicts an explicit written approval by Naked.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces significant ambiguity regarding intellectual property ownership. The added phrase "unless otherwise agreed in writing" to the joint ownership clause allows for potential future conflicts over Wade Products IP. Similarly, limiting Wade's ownership of his image only to uses not directly related to Naked Products creates uncertainty. The ownership of advertising material, previously absolute for Naked, is now shared, and Wade's acknowledgement of not asserting rights is now conditional. This creates potential for disputes over IP usage and control.

perturbation.original_text:
12. Termination.

A. Naked shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon ten (10) days prior written notice to Wade in the event Wade fails to perform the Wade Services or breaches any other covenant or agreement set forth herein (including the essence of this Agreement), and fails to cure same (if curable) within seven (7) days of receipt of written notice. Such termination shall relieve Naked of its obligation to provide any further consideration pursuant to this Agreement provided that Wade shall retain all warrants he has received hereunder that have vested as of the date of such termination. In the event of such termination as a result of a material breach of this Agreement by Wade (i) Wade's contractual liabilities and obligations until the date of termination still exist notwithstanding such termination, (ii)  Naked shall be under no obligation to sell any Wade Products but shall nevertheless owe the Royalty on any Wade Products sold; and (iii) notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, Wade shall forfeit all warrants he has received hereunder. Naked shall not have waived any of its rights at law or in equity by exercising any provision of this section.

B. Wade shall have the right to  terminate this Agreement upon ten (10) days prior written notice to Naked in the  event of the occurrence of any of the following: (i) Naked is adjudicated as insolvent or declares bankruptcy; or (ii) Naked fails to provide consideration due pursuant to this Agreement, within ten (10) days following the date such consideration is due hereunder (or, if Wade elects to receive stock in lieu of the cash consideration, if Naked fails to instruct its transfer agent to issue the appropriate amount of Common Stock to Wade within ten (10) days following the date such consideration is due in the event such consideration is payable in Common Stock); provided that Naked is notified in writing of such non-payment by Wade and such payment by Naked is not made within three (3) days following such notification; or (iii) Naked breaches any  covenant or agreement set forth herein and fails to cure same (if curable)  within seven (7) days of receipt of written notice. Furthermore, Naked agrees that such termination shall not relieve it of its obligation to provide consideration as contemplated hereunder. Wade shall not have waived any of his rights at law or in equity by exercising any provision of this section.
perturbation.changed_text:
12. Termination.

A. Naked shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon ten (10) days prior written notice to Wade in the event Wade fails to perform the Wade Services or breaches any other covenant or agreement set forth herein (including the essence of this Agreement), and fails to cure same (if curable) within seven (7) days of receipt of written notice. Such termination may, at Naked's discretion, relieve Naked of its obligation to provide any further consideration pursuant to this Agreement; however, Wade's vested warrants may also be subject to forfeiture depending on the specific circumstances of the breach, as determined solely by Naked. In the event of such termination as a result of a material breach of this Agreement by Wade (i) Wade's contractual liabilities and obligations until the date of termination still exist notwithstanding such termination, (ii) Naked shall be under no obligation to sell any Wade Products but shall nevertheless owe the Royalty on any Wade Products sold, unless the breach relates to the sales of any Wade Products; and (iii) Wade shall forfeit all warrants he has received hereunder if Naked decides so, with the only exception that Naked expressly approved the warrants, in written form. Naked shall not have waived any of its rights at law or in equity by exercising any provision of this section.

B. Wade shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon ten (10) days prior written notice to Naked only with Naked's express written authorization. In the  event of the occurrence of any of the following: (i) Naked is adjudicated as insolvent or declares bankruptcy; or (ii) Naked fails to provide consideration due pursuant to this Agreement, within ten (10) days following the date such consideration is due hereunder (or, if Wade elects to receive stock in lieu of the cash consideration, if Naked fails to instruct its transfer agent to issue the appropriate amount of Common Stock to Wade within ten (10) days following the date such consideration is due in the event such consideration is payable in Common Stock); provided that Naked is notified in writing of such non-payment by Wade and such payment by Naked is not made within three (3) days following such notification; or (iii) Naked breaches any covenant or agreement set forth herein and fails to cure same (if curable) within seven (7) days of receipt of written notice. Furthermore, Naked can decide to relieve itself of its obligation to provide consideration as contemplated hereunder. Wade shall not have waived any of his rights at law or in equity by exercising any provision of this section.
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation introduces a significant power imbalance in the termination clauses. While the original agreement provides relatively balanced termination rights, the modified version heavily favors Naked. Specifically, it makes Naked's obligation to provide further consideration discretionary upon Wade's breach, while previously it was not. It also introduces uncertainty about warrant forfeiture, previously clear-cut, depending solely on Naked's determination. Furthermore, Wade's termination rights are severely restricted by requiring Naked's express written authorization, essentially nullifying Wade's ability to terminate based on Naked's actions. Naked can also now decide to relieve itself of obligations to provide consideration, in case Wade decided to terminate the agreement.
